verbose_text: If the catalyst is detached from the surface, the Ni 2+ ions released upon photodecomposition of the metal complex can cause the production of molecular hydrogen at the CdS surface, as already observed in similar systems.81 A selectivity for CO generation higher than 90% was observed in case of the nickel - terpyridine complex bearing thiol moieties (that is, [Ni (terpyS) 2] 2+, Figure XREF_FIG), which exhibit a strong affinity for the CdS surface.
evidence: Ni 2+  ions released upon photodecomposition of the metal complex can cause the production of molecular hydrogen
